column4: I'm setting up a new storage hard disk, and it's asking for a partition table. ----- I see the msdos is the default partition table, but is there a better (opensource) parition table I should use?
will you use it in other OS? or just linux?
well it's an internal hard disk so I'm fine with a linux-only parition table ---- Also, I'm formating it with ext4, so that in itself will make it Linux-only without extra software on Windows
what software are you using to format it?
so you've decided to go with ext4 as the Filesystem
well yes. I'm already using it for my system hard disk, and it's been very reliable, and definitely faster
good. but what was your problem again? partition table type? I don't remember being prompted by gparted about partition tables

my problem is the following; I just bought this hard disk (2 TB Western Digital) and so far I've plugged it in and run gparted. The first message I got when choosing "new" from the menu, was a message asking me which parition table I wanted. It tells me msdos is default, but that sounds strange, but opensource-wise and best-software-wise
hard to say, because i've never ran into that situation before.
alright well since msdos is default I guess I'll stick with that. Better safe than sorry I suppose.
interesting discussion but the result was sadly...
so I guess I'll stick with the default to make sure everything runs
yeah. msdos seems the way to go here. i don't think you want to try with the other alternatives mentioned: aix, amiga, bsd, dvh, gpt, mac, pc98, sun, loop
haha yeah, those aren't really any better I suppose, just different; thanks for the help
you're welcome. I learned something today
